channel.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
channel.description:
[img]http://media.bestofmicro.com/5/A/223102/original/Linux3.jpg[/img]
LIES LIES LIES
Discuss [size=1pt]why Linux is superior to Windows.[/size]

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:

#4 who the hell even uses video chat >.<

You’re a funny person. Why do you think every laptop released nowadays comes with a camera? So they can take pictures? Pfft, 'sif people wish to take good pictures with a 1.3-2mp camera.
[/quote]

i don’t know anyone who uses it…[/quote]

which clearly means nobody does

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I think they say there is more hardware/software compatibility because you don’t need to configure useless bullshit all day.

</3 Linux. Linux isn’t meant for a home workstation, I’d say.

#4 who the hell even uses video chat >.<
You're a funny person. Why do you think every laptop released nowadays comes with a camera? So they can take pictures? Pfft, 'sif people wish to take good pictures with a 1.3-2mp camera.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

Who cares honestly? I do favor Linux over Microsoft but is it REALLY a big deal? It’s marketing, they want people to use their stuff. If confused faggots want to use their shit, so be it. It’s not our fault, atleast we have a decent OS.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

#1 they don’t mention alternatives to windows live
#2 the intent of linux users is not to play games (i do but i dual boot)
#3 out of the box, there is no good mp3 and printer compatibility, download a couple codecs and drivers and your set
#4 who the hell even uses video chat >.<
#5 its open source, if you need support, change the system

Haha they are probably comparing to Damn Small Linux, or an out of the box Arch linux.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @TheGuyWhoGotOn TheGuyWhoGotOn
item.description:
@TheGuyWhoGotOn wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:32, topic:301219”]So I phoned up Best Buy on Skype the other day and asked them if they could set up Linux on a computer for me, $190 for Geek Squad to install it. I then proceeded to ask if they could install Slackware 3.1 off my set of 29 floppy disks and they got a little confused…
The guy told me that Ubuntu is pretty much as compatible as XP and it shouldn’t be too difficult to get started with. I guess Canada has been spared…for now.[/quote]

$190…ouch, I install Ubuntu 9.10 (Wine, Java, Flash, Drivers, blah, blah, blah) for people for just $15 :P. I’ve never gone to Best Buy before…Looks like now I never will.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

So I phoned up Best Buy on Skype the other day and asked them if they could set up Linux on a computer for me, $190 for Geek Squad to install it. I then proceeded to ask if they could install Slackware 3.1 off my set of 29 floppy disks and they got a little confused…
The guy told me that Ubuntu is pretty much as compatible as XP and it shouldn’t be too difficult to get started with. I guess Canada has been spared…for now.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Mopman:

The dumbest thing is it all works fine, but the installer just doesn’t let you install. If you hax the installer to think you’re running something else it works 100%.

You can also use the msi file, but the newest version just won’t work for me at all.

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

This was a sheet sent out to BestBuy workers in the US to use to sell Windows to people. The type of people who won’t ever have the level of knowledge to ever bother even thinking about linux. So on the surface, this is true when taken in context of who it is supposed to be aimed at.

Read full topic

item.description:

[size=1pt]To state the obvious[/size] microsoft are wrong, windows live essentials aren’t supported in windows server 2003(which is what XP 64bit is based on iirc).

item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:22, topic:301219”]no, the vista driver model was completely different

vista drivers run on 7, though.[/quote]

I could run my laptops xp drivers on vista (Dell latitude l400, 1999 with 256mb ram)…
I could also use windows 2000 network card drivers on windows server 2008.

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:22, topic:301219”]no, the vista driver model was completely different

vista drivers run on 7, though.[/quote]

Well, there are no vista or win7 drivers, and as this is windows that means I am screwed. It’s ok, I love linux far to much to use win7 anyway, I just needed windows on srt8’s computer because she is in some class where they have to use some proprietary windows program that interfaces with office 07, gag me…

Read full topic

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

From personal experience, if you are lucky to have supported hardware Windows 7 is very helpful. I installed Win 7 on a netbook and expected to manually download the acpi drivers from asus, however Windows 7 managed to notify me that the driver is missing and provide a direct link to it. It was a 2 click operation.

Read full topic

item.description:

Mopman:

thats a slight exageration, all the time vista has been out and you cant find vista drivers for her hardware? was it all made in 1981?

The laptop is a Gateway CX2610.

item.title: M$ being asshole towards Linux
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xEnt:

the drivers may not be written by them, but they do a lot of work to ensure lots of drivers are included with their OS increasing their compatibility level. I can boot windows 7 and not even install 1 driver, and everything works perfectly (sound, games etc)

Really? Because I boot into linux on srt8’s laptop and don’t have to do a thing, everything just works. I boot into windows 7 and no wifi, no graphics driver, no SD card reader driver, I’m surprised it runs at all. And I can’t find drivers for any of it.

Read full topic
